61862146
>>61858975
Los Angeles is a shithole. San Francisco lost all sovl because no one who lives there is actually from San Francisco anymore. D.C. is literally a dilapidated nigger den. New York is cool and iconic but is also a lonely hive where everyone is disconnected despite living 10,000 to a city block.

>>61859319

>>61858982

61862380
>>61861591
This. I'm from DC too, but I left that shithole years ago. Everyone is a bureaucratic suit who aspires to work for the government or some adjacent entity. Sure there might be ethnic diversity, but there is no cultural diversity at all. Quite literally everyone is a libtard. Not to mention the women there are not only busted but also extremely deluded in thinking that they deserve Chads. A DC 10 is a Miami or NYC 6.

>>61859324
Can confirm, LA is great. Every month I have to remember to not self-dox because retards are talking about what a shithole it is here, and I want to take a photo of my window view showing that it looks exactly the same as the white southern suburb they all fantasize about. Just don't live in the poor part of town. That rule applies to every city on earth.

We have *real* mexican food for cheap, no bad weather, and as many asian women and big booty latinas as you could ever want.

>>61862380

>>61858975

>>61858975
most of those cities suck ass and are basically open air prisons for white collar wageslaves. people with money "in LA" live on or near the beach. people with money "in DC" live in surrounding areas like bethesda or chevy chase.

61864816
>>61858975
I enjoy Manhattan and visiting SOCAL but living there would be too much. I lived on in Santa Monica for a year and anytime you'd want to do something you had to plan around traffic. Not a way to live you entire life. There's a ton of great nature in southern California so even if you're not into le hustle and bustle you're still able to have a good time.

61868506
>>61858975
wow gringos are really fucking retarded, who gives a fuck about your shitty cities??

61869839
>>61858975

There's no surplus of 20-29 year old white women in LA.

Open thread • Replies: 17 • Updated: 2026-02-18 13:29 UTC

OP

How do I short NYC?

Early replies (first 3)

61868918
>>61868898
>middle class owning property in New York
hehe, good one

61868957
>>61868918
>property tax goes up 10%
>landlord keeps the rent the same price

61868970
>>61868898
puts on SLG, VNO, VICI

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61868974
>>61868957
why would jews do that

61868986
>>61868898
Landlords must be so happy with this

61869005
Taxes go up > Rents go up > Welfare goes up
And guess who owns all those buildings?

61869011
>>61868898
How is his base responding to this? All the people who were so certain he could actually do what he said and would totally fix NYC with money it doesn't have?

61869014
>>61868918
>>61868957
Actual rich people in NYC use a loophole where their building/unit is somehow tied to a much lower valued building on the same block.
So a penthouse they bought for $50M has a paper value of like $500k.

Anyone who thinks the wealthy actually gets shafted by tax increases and that the politicians they own won't leave loopholes open for them, not just in NYC but in pretty much every western country, are absolutely delusional.
Taxing the rich is just a convenient excuse politicians use to raise taxes with the peasants blessings.

61869016
>>61868898
I can't believe anyone actually lives in NYC. Genuinely.

61869109
>>61869016
seriously, at least in california the weather and landscape makes it worth it.

61869172
>>61869016
what, you don't like being stabbed by niggers in the subway??

61869185
Who cares? What they're doing is great for the poor. All poor socialists need to move to NYC ASAP and take advantage of the New New York. We should all be buying them bus tickets.

61869354
>>61868918
When you go to a restaurant, you are paying their property taxes and when you pay rent you are paying the property owners property taxes.

This is one level of abstraction so if you cannot understand this it would indicate that your IQ is extremely low.

61869533
>>61868898

Just goes to show how horrible the Republican candidate must have been that THIS was the better choice.
One of the main reasons Trump was elected was because the Democratic candidates were THAT bad (unlikable women both times)

61869557
>>61869533
No?
Mummy Dummy just told retard Dem New Yorkers what they wanted to hear. It's literally out of a 4th grader playback for school elections.

Biden wanted to run again, and after that absolutely disastrous debate against Trump. Harris was the VP but never was she going to win against a man who survived an assassination attempt.

item.title: Oldfags on this board... what was it like hunting for a job in 2021-2022 ? — 16 replies — 22.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
Oldfags on this board... what was it like hunting for a job in 2021-2022 ?

Open thread • Replies: 16 • Updated: 2026-02-18 12:54 UTC

OP

>be me
>zoomer wagie stuck in application hell
>look at the linkedin of every mid-level manager/engineer at FAANG/Fortune 500
>notice a pattern
>literally every single one of them (mostly jeets/chinks) got hired between 2020-2022 while I was still in high school
>mfw

Is it just me or was the bar literally on the floor back then? What was the "process" even like for you dinosaurs? Did you just walk in, pulse check, firm handshake, and get handed a 250k TC package with stock options?

Explain to me how you guys actually got hired during the infinite money glitch era without sounding like you just got lucky.

Early replies (first 3)

61868988
>>61868983
they reached out to me from LinkedIn and asked me to interview. I interviewed with them, passed the interview and then they hired me. They asked me to fill out the job application paperwork after I already did a few interviews to "make it official". Then I got an offer for close to 400k TC and took it.

61869002
>>61868983
Nobody wanted to work because covid relief was so good. You could make more on unemploymenr than working and you could put off paying a lot of your bills. Getting a job was easy if you wanted one.

61869003
>>61868983
I graduated with a degree in Physics in December 2019. Covid hit early 2020. I worked at a gas station for 4 months before getting factory work. I worked on the factory floor for all of covid, and only got a job in my field in 2023. It was hell.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61869023
>>61868983
Hiring managers and recruiters were cold calling everyone with tech experience and offering high paying jobs after first interview. It was kind of nuts. I wish I knew just how desperate companies were back then because I could have gotten a much better job than the one I took.

61869024
It's not the timing, it's because they're Indian.

61869068
>>61868983
>Job hunting in 2021 is oldfag status
>mfw when 40

61869072
>>61868983
I graduated a year before covid and the company I work for basically had a policy where they didn't hire new grads that didn't graduate before covid.

61869094
got a random email one day asking me if I wanted to join their company, no resume or anything, and thats where I am today

61869113
>>61868983
I started applaying for a new job in jan 21 and in april i landed a new one with 50% increase. After a few months i started applying again and in 22 i got a remote job with almost 100% salary increase and a more favourable taxation. This kind of leap is the easiest early in your career, it gets much more difficult later.

61869617
>>61869023
This. I took that first $120k position and ran with it. I worked my other job too though so $120k + $75k. The job laid off 30% of the company in a year though.
>>61868983
It was crazy, multiple recruiters in your DMs on linkedin a day. Always got an interview if you applied. Everything was remote nearly and good pay. Feels like you were the hot HS QB for a year then you graduated, got fat and forgotten about. I went to get my PhD in the mean time.

61869636
>>61868983
i'm an accountingfag not a techfag. that said, the job market in 2021 was very good. at the time i only had 3 YOE and i would get like 15-20 recruiter messages a month. i interviewed all over for remote jobs. today, even with more experience and several promotions to management, i'm lucky to get like 5 recruiter messages a month and all of the jobs sound like shit (remote is rare.)

61869678
>>61869636
CPA here
Governmentmaxxing
Pensionmaxxing
Comfymaxxing

Biggest challenge in government is once you bet high enough, you’re working closely with elected officials who have totally different perspective than normal people

61869716
>>61868983
There was a massive wave of boomers taking retirement then and companies got caught with their pants down because they hadn't hired and trained anyone in decades so yeah they hired literally anyone including zoomers and the wave of indians out of panic.

61869731
>>61869678
ive looked at government jobs. i wouldnt dream of working fed govt after trump fired millions of fed workers. state/local pay sucks unless youre at like the director level, but remote is rare and is always subject to some niggerfaggot politician demanding all government wagies return to the wage cage so as to pump jewish commercial real elstate bags.

61869734
>>61868983
it was already fucked by 2020 and saturated with jeet nepo
the age of waltzing into a tech job with minimal skills and walking away rich was 90s-2016

61869736
>2021 makes you an oldfag
Not for /biz/ specifically, but I wonder what these zoomers and alphoomers would think of us that have been around since like 2012
I still remember being called a newfag back then too

item.title: Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop?? — 24 replies — 19.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop??

Open thread • Replies: 24 • Updated: 2026-02-18 12:22 UTC

OP

Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop??

Early replies (first 3)

61864202
LinkedIn is complete dogshit so I guess not.

61864249
>>61864195
I got my job off a posting on Handshake

61864299
>>61864195
I honestly don't believe anyone is getting jobs on linkedin anymore. Nobody.
I tried almost 2 years and sent hundreds upon hundreds of applications.
Fake jobs.
AI fake recruiters.
All bullshit man.
I got my job off a local job board finally.
LinkedIn has only one use to find you a job: post to your hundreds of connections asking if anyone can refer you to a job. It's a networking site.
I add the maximum number of connections every week in my industry targeted at companies I might want to work for in the future.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61864306
>>61864195
LinkedIn is full of indians

61865108

61867912
In Ireland, recruiters are actually pretty good and you can build a network through them. Unfortunately I'm not in Ireland now and all Irish jobs are hybrid. European based roles naturally require working fluency in another language and that's a bridge too far at the moment, even though I speak 3 other languages to various degrees

LinkedIn seems to be quite tricky to stand out through even with customised CVs (via AI) for every application.

Unfortunately, competition and noise are both high. Personal connections are still far and away your best option (if they are an option)

61867924
Indeed is full of scam postings, so not that.

I've tried welcometothejungle.com for applying to remote jobs, but since they're remote, don't really expect to get an interview - competition is still sky high since everyone's laid off now. Job market's totally fucked all around, so any workarounds you might find are already oversaturated. Sorry.

>>61864195

item.title: Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us? — 40 replies — 16.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?

Open thread • Replies: 40 • Updated: 2026-02-18 11:06 UTC

OP

You guys in the EU make less than us on paychecks, but you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare and PTO while we have to pay for private insurance which chronically denies people's health situations.

Are people saying that starting a business in the EU is difficult because of the regulations? What regulations does the European union impose on its citizen's than they think it's easier to start in the United States instead?

Early replies (first 3)

61860815
>>61860796
Depends enormously on which country are we talking about. Some are easy (Germany) some are very hard (Italy)

61860817
>>61860796
> you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare
yeah right
good luck getting that "universal healthcare" if you're not a boomer, waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure. It's either you go private (and pay out of your own pocket) or you die
> and PTO
oh wow, 20 wagie cagie free days a year. Totally worth the 60%+ taxes.

All taxation is theft. It's just that. Taxation doesn't pay for services. It's just the way they control the economy, and here in EU they fucking LOVE to control what you can and cannot do. They print the money, they don't need to tax you. They tax you to control you (and to humiliate you)

61860822
>>61860796
The healthcare thing is too much american leftie argument, it also has been very overcrowded by you guessed arabs and africans, unironically I was better treated when I broke my leg in brazil of all places then in france

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61860967
in my country, the one thing one has to look out for is paying for your own social/healthinsurance, ie, if you have your own business, you need to pay taxes for your own health/socialinsurance, and the taxman wont ask you for the first 3y of that business.
After the 3y pass, you will then have to payup all the retrospective social insurance tax costs incurred, which fucks over a lot of retard or unfortunate first business owners

61861032
>>61860837
This is why we need a unified EU business regulation and undermind the corrupt sovereignist that want to keep individual burocratic fuckery.

61861057
>>61860815
>Some are easy (Germany)
> some are very hard (Italy)
let me guess italian never tried germany?
Germany is known to be a bureucracy hellhole with people fleeing to other countries from it.

>>61861032
>unified will fix it
France&germany have been dictating eu lawmaking. You will eat shit as you already do. You have eu wide higher taxes because germany didnt want to compete and made mandatory higher minimum vat a thing.

Not to mention that countries that joined got their industries destroyed by unified regulation and had to import from germany/france what they used to produce themself

61861071
It's the one thing the USA gets right. I personally made a "business" (that never made any profit) in the span of an afternoon. Cost maybe $200 to get my identification numbers for the llc

61861091
>>61861032
yeah let's give the EU bureaucrats more power that will fix it

61861111
>>61860796
>Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?
Depends on the business. If you want to do something shady the US is the place to go. The US has barely any standards and barely any regulations.

61861113
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure
What are you talking about? I live currently in the EU and have never had to wait for medical care.

61861119
Us is easier.
I have created 2 corpos and 1 llc for different purposes within the past 8 years. You can do it all online for a few bucks, other regulations depend on specific industry but overall it's pretty easy

61861128
>>61860860
higher taxation alone puts euros at a disadvantage. Its fine if you do a local job since you compete with locals but anything online / shipped its bad since they have to be more efficient than rest of world to reach same profit margin.

As for amount of bureaucracy its fucking complex and depends on what country and what profession. There is even stupid shit like if you run a repair shop and repair inside your building it counts different than if you decide to drive to your customer and repair locally. In the later case they classify you as a handyman worker and will fine you if you didn't register with the craftsman ministry. Also if you do something you didn't register for you will also be fined but you can register as " i will do anything" more broadly and dodge it. The amount of bullshit can easily fill a book.

61861429
>>61860796
Depends on what your goals are, the type of business, your personal goals and the markets you wish to enter. In general it's more of an investment in the long run but if you plan to offer your services or products in the EU anyway it makes sense to start your business here and already be compliant

61861441
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure.
Yeah, I remember waiting decades for my appendicitis, it rupturing and me dying because of it. Thankfully they could keep me alive for months despite the extreme difficulties this poses.

>>61861032
We need more unified European regulation. Sadly the EU is not an economic alliance anymore.

61862545
>>61860796
>>61860860
I love how hard it is to even talk about european economy on reddit, not because of europeans, but because of american lefties, if you so much, and most times you don't even need to, mention the US, they will flock like a horde to claim the US lies about everything, that 30% of americans are unemployed and nearly no one in europe, the EU is literal worker's paradise and how much they love their welfare policies and hate the US greed, its quite hilarious really how much they want a nanny state.

61865504
It is, soon it will was once EU Inc comes into play

61865623
>>61860796
>you have universal healthcare
yea but you have to wait 1 year+ because there is a million niggers in queue before you

61865645
>>61861057
Lol this is true.
Germany and France made the EU suck with their shit like GDPR etc. Spain happily sniffs every turd. The rest aren't better.

61866460
If your efforts are starting to go anywhere, your own government will make sure, you won't get any further.
They hate nothing more than citizens that are not dependent on them. That's why they are allowing third world people in to the maximum extent physically possible, that are never going end up being a "plus" on the balance sheet, but that they hope will be cheap voting sheep for their party. The people pay for them after all, not the party.
Effectively: If Elon Musk was a citizen of a EU-country, he'd already be in jail waiting for the sentence to be sent to prison. You probably don't want to get into that situation.

61866966
>>61865645
>Le GDPR sucks because uhm JUST LET ME HAVE YOUR DATA

61867520
>>61861071
It’s also as easy in my country (Finland)

61867536
>>61860796
>you get to keep more money
Except they have to pay more in taxes to wait in line for months whole muslim refugees who didnt pay go before them kek. Europeans are so dumb its unreal.

61867540
>>61860796
italy here.
50% tax is ok ?
this is shITALY

61867547
>>61860796
It's literally impossible to build any meaningful sized company in Europe because the entire E.U. is designed to prevent anyone from competing with the aristocratic class and the privately held billion dollar company their great great grandfather built in 1870.

61867554
>>61860842
YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE TALKING ABOUT

61867577
Europe has no tech industry because German rich fags were afraid to pay coders more than traditional engineers because then car engineers would ask for more money so they just fucked all of Europe and let America and China run everything.

61868041
>>61860796
No, in some places is actually easy, I remember playing a game in class one time in uni to look regulations for business worldwide, there's almost no difference whatsoever in european and american regulations, sometimes american regulations are actually worse and the accumulated taxes from city, state, federal can surpass european taxes. The only conclusion we could draw was that europeans were just lazy and too laidback, they have so much welfare that there's no rush or anxiety with ending up destitute and homeless so they just don't bother with the hazzle of building a business. They are better off just being on benefits or unemployed, most business there predate the big social welfare network just because of a need to survive really and complacency in changing what already works, they are much much better off.

61868110
>>61867547
>>61867577
that's bullshit but i believe it

61868167
>>61867602
rip Sbarro

61868190
>>61868041
this is actually hilarious

61868222
>>61868190
Mostly sad, americans either are prosperous or starve

61869496
>>61868041
>They are better off just being on benefits or unemployed
Can confirm, although it's currently also due to absolutely no one fucking hiring, because Germany is fucked beyond reasonable short-term hope.
It's also really troublesome to do any kind of work-like activities while on benefits, because that could easily cause the termination of those.

If I got a deed to a substantial amount of the land the federal government loves to horde so much I could see myself parting with all (some) of my specie.
